author: Lockhart1433

text:
How is this your first song from Phantasia? I love Sakuraba's early style, however, I prefer the soundtrack from PS1 remake of Phantasia over the SNES version. Probably has something to do with not playing the SNES version, except a little bit of the DEJAP version a long time ago, and playing the PS1 remake early this year.

Destiny is still my favorite, the soundtrack is so wicked, and his work on Destiny 2(Eternia) and Star Ocean the second story, are among my favorites as well.

author: James Rode

text: Yeah all of the SNES to GBA ports butchered the audio hard. Â The SNES had a sound chip that was WAY the fuck ahead of its time - Sony's SPC700 chip - which supported all sorts of custom programming and custom samples uploaded directly from the cartridge. Â Unfortunately when Sony and Nintendo split over the PlayStation add-on which became... well.. the PlayStation, Nintendo lost any chance of using Sony tech in future systems, so the GBA and N64's sound chips are a MASSIVE downgrade from the SNES's.

text: Xillia is pretty good I'd recommend it. I didn't like graces very much though. The gameplay was good, but I couldn't stand the personality of every character except Pascal, Malik, and Sophie; they really killed it for me.

author: virgil9940

text: If you've played Destiny on the PS1, I would recommend its PS2 remake. It's playable with little knowledge of Japanese if you know the story of the original. Even if you're a bit fuzzy on the details, it'll clearly highlight where to go next on the world map. Any minor confusion or need for menu/tech guides is worth it for the best battle system in the series imo.
author: Aifread

text: I feel like I'm the only one who did not like Tales of Symphonia at all... I managed to beat the entire game, which felt like an eternity, but I realize that this is not my style of game (art-wise, story-wise, character-wise, voice-wise, item-wise), but the spells, fighting was not that bad.
author: David Harris

text: i feel the same bro the first was phantasia and the one that got me hooked up was destiny but eternia and abyss my favorite ones waiting for xillia 2 for northamerica xD
author: YggdrasilGameplays YGamers

text:
+SupraDarky Here's all the Tales advice you need:
Phantasia- Good; Recommended starting point
Destiny- Good
Eternia- Pretty Good
Symphonia- Amazing
Legendia- Terrible; met a guy who literally couldn't give this game away
Abyss- Amazing
Dawn of the New World- Decent game, sub-par sequel
Vesperia- Best in the series by far. Worthy of buying an xbox for
Graces- Garbage
Xillia- Great; Everything Graces did wrong, but done right
Xillia 2- AVOID AT ALL COSTS
Zestiria- Ending is Mass Effect-level bad. Overall Meh...
